sections.title: Financing Your Venture
sections.subtitle: Exploring funding options and choosing the right path for your business

sections.title: What You'll Learn
items: Debt financing options for small businesses
Government grants and alternative funding sources

sections.title: Self-Funding and Bootstrapping
sections.content: Bootstrapping means starting and growing your business using personal savings, revenue from initial sales, or minimal external funding. This approach maintains full control but requires careful cash flow management. Many successful businesses, including Dell and GitHub, started as bootstrapped ventures.

points.title: Personal Savings and Credit
points.description: Use personal funds or credit cards, but be cautious about personal financial risk.

points.title: Business Loans
points.description: Traditional bank loans, SBA loans, or online lenders provide debt financing with fixed repayment terms.

points.title: Equity Investment
points.description: Sell ownership stakes to angel investors, venture capitalists, or through crowdfunding platforms.

sections.title: Choose Funding Based on Your Stage
sections.content: Early-stage businesses typically bootstrap or seek friends/family funding. Growth-stage businesses may attract angel or venture capital investment.

sections.title: Alternative Funding Sources
sections.content: Consider government grants for specific industries, crowdfunding for product-based businesses, or business incubators/accelerators that provide funding and mentorship. Each option has different requirements and expectations for returns or control.

sections.title: Plan Your Funding Strategy
steps: Calculate your startup and first-year operating costs realistically
Determine how much funding you need and by when
Research funding options that match your business type and stage
Prepare necessary documents like business plans and financial projections

sections.title: Focus on Revenue First
sections.content: The best funding is customer revenue. Focus on generating sales early rather than seeking external funding, as this validates your business model and gives you leverage in funding discussions.
